title: Drawing, "Bed Alcove for the Duc d'Orléans, Palais Royal, Paris", ca. 1716
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor on white laid paper
inscribed: Pen and black ink; upper margin: Face de L'alcove pour la chambre a coucher de S.A.R. Lower margin, the scale is inscribed: 5 toises; followed by: les Colonnes auron 12 pd 1/2/ de hauteur sur 15 pou (ce) de / diametre par bas
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Alcove seen in elevation frontally, with bed a la duchesse (no footboard and canopy supported from the ceiling) enclosed by a balustrade which supports two fluted and gilded composite columns. the state bed shows the cypher of the Regent, Philippe Charles, Duc d'Orleans. The height is indicated at the right.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Bed Alcove for the Duc d'Orléans, Palais Royal, Paris", ca. 1716. Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-81.
